name: Grand Hotel Bohemia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008
reviews.text: My wife and I got married at St Nicholas Church in the Old Town Square in Prague in late April 08. We had our reception in the beautiful Boccacio Ballroom at the Grand Hotel Bohemia.... a truly historic and stunning venue (just take a look at the photo on their website!).
reviews.title: Beautiful Wedding Reception

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A number of the guests also stayed at the hotel with us in the week leading up to the wedding, and everyone had the same experience of the hotel.... Excellent. The hotel itself is perfectly positioned just behind the Old Town Square, it is a wonderfully historic building and the rooms have been recently renovated but still retain real character. Beds are really comfy too with firm mattresses. The staff were incredibly helpful and friendly throughout our stay which really helped with so much to do in the run up to the big day. The reception itself went so smoothly thanks to the attentive staff, and the food served was excellent, even for over 60 guests!
reviews.title: Such A Comfort With All The Trimmings Laid On !!

likes.liked: — the professional attitude and look of the place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Can't say enough about the Hotel, staff etc and our whole experience there....look forward to going back really soon.
reviews.title: Perfect stay in Prauge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: When we arrived in Prague to see Czech friends, we had booked at Seven Angels, but found it lacking. so eventually found this one.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.liked: — location, primarily, excellent staff attention/ service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Such a clean and friendly and professional hotel with wonderful
reviews.title: Lovely historic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Bohemia one weekend in late november. It's a very nice hotel with nice service and very good breakfast. The rooms are kept clean and nice. Good breakfast. We didn't try any lunch or dinner at the hotel, but they had restaurang. It's in walking distance too all major sihgtseeing in Prague. Can recomend it to all.
reviews.title: Hotel Bohemia - very nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel Christmas Day & Boxing Day 2011 and could not praise the service & standard of the hotel enough. The desk staff went out of their way to find us a table for dinner. Room was spotless and very comfortable. Room service on time. Five minute walk to Astronomical clock in old town. Highly recommended for a stay.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: A good friend and I decided to spend the Christmas weekend in Prague. This hotel was perfectly located near the Old Town. I was impressed by the ease of finding the location. The room was well appointed and the fresh fruit and cookies were a great welcome to the room. The hotel was just the right balance of romance and charm in a great place.
reviews.title: Christmas in Prague!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: This hotel is in such a great location. A short walk through the nearby ancient City Gate takes you to Old Town Square. The hotel was nicely remodeled with the amenities I wanted. The staff were always willing to help with everything we asked about with a smile. Breakfast was buffet style,both hot and cold dishes, which we enjoyed. Great view from the seventh floor room window.
reviews.title: nice place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: Wi-Fi in the room was not free. The air conditioning wasn't very good.
reviews.title: Great Service, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Hotel was very nice.clean beautiful rooms.view from window is great.its position is near to most places we wanted to go to. team are very cooperative and helpful.breakfast is delicious.thanks a lot
reviews.title: very nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The Grand Hotel Bohemia packs a lot of punch and panache for the money. It is in a fabulous location within an easy, safe walk to Old Town Square and many other attractions. The staff was very helpful and accomodating. While my room was an interior room with no view, it was blissfuly quiet and felt like an oasis in the middle of all the energy of this amazing city. The breakfast was very good and offered something for everyone. Overall, I would give the hotel a vey good to excellent rating and would submit that it offers a phenomenal value in a phenomenal City!
reviews.title: PRAGUE: Amazing City and Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel represented very good value and we would certainly recommend it. The staff were all very friendly, pleasant and efficient and all seemed keen to provide a good quality of service.
reviews.title: Very good hotel within easy and short walking distance to the Old Town Square

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a bedroom on the 6th floor overlooking the main entrance and could just the spires of the cathedral up at the castle - we think there were some bedrooms that overlooked the rear of the hotel and not sure if these would have much of a view. Our bedroom was a decent size, well equipped with good quality furnishings and a very comfortable large double bed. the en-suite was a reasonable size, well furnished however the water pressure from the shower was not very good and the temperature did vary considerably - this is our only fault with the hotel.
reviews.title: Wonderful city, wonderful hotel!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast each morning was to a very good standard with a wide variety of choice, both hot and cold dishes from a well presented buffet area. On each of the four evenings we were there the restaurant seemed very quiet and therefore we never ate in. On our arrival we shared the cheese platter which we had served in the bar and this was well presented with good quality cheeses and breads.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel
Locatiopn, Location.
reviews.text: The Grand Bohemia was a pleasant surprise. We arrived before 10 am and our room was ready for us. The staff was very helpful and all spoke good English. The location of the hotel is perfect. All the major attractions are within easy walking distance and the only time we used the public transport was to go to Saska Arena to see Pearl Jam. The metro and the public transport is cheap and easy to use. The hotel is situated on a quiet street, so you can sleep easily at night. We found Prague to be a very safe city, even when coming out of a club at 4 am.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: The only reason we have given this hotel a 4 rating is because the room was nothing like the pictures on expedia. The rooms are spacious and very clean with a decent sized bathroom.
reviews.title: Loved Prague, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would recommend this hotel, but would recommend booking directly with them as we found out it was cheaper to do that when we were there. The ballroom is lovely, but we had to ask to see this. We did not eat at the hotel as their are better priced restaurants and bars within a 5 minute walk. Eat at "Ambiente" the food, service is excellent and at a very good price £28.00 for 3 course meal for two with wine and coffee. We look forward to going back to Prague and staying at the Grand Bohemia again.
reviews.title: Good Location, not bad rooms and communist no more

likes.disliked: — Hotel could use a mid-life upgrade

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Grand Hotel Bohemia is in a fantastic location; walk to all including the Astonomical Clock and restaurants, yet off to the side so it is quiet. The rooms are simple, clean and on the small side. One travel book we read described the rooms as enormous, but we didn't find that to be true. The lobby and restaurant are elegant and lovely. We enjoyed the buffet breakfast each morning; lots of choices. You do have to stay on top of them if you order anything specially prepared as they forget about the order. The staff is helpful regarding suggestions for dinner. Housekeeping was a little remiss and we searched for them for fresh towels after they only partially made up the room. Overall we would recommend this hotel for Prague; good value for your money and the location cannot be beat.
reviews.title: Nice hotel/good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: According to the hotel’s own literature, this facility has had a long history of catering to the elite. First as one of the most exclusive night clubs in the city and then later as a facility for high ranking communist officials. During the latter era, the hotel was not listed in any guide book or even in the telephone directory. Today you can find the Hotel Grand Bohemia (HGB) in most travel guides, Expedia (with whom we booked) and of course here on Trip Advisor (how we found HGB).
reviews.title: perfect location

likes.disliked: — book early for a good deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: I've been to Prague three times and this is my favourite of the three hotels. Unlike some cities, you are not really going to get a view from your room, the hotel is crowded within the old town. But it's a lovely hotel with charming staff. I would certainly stay there again and would consider this hotel amongs the tops in the city, especially if you admire old world charm and want to be whickedc back to the days of yonder.
reviews.title: Charming Hotel in the Old Town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cannot fault this hotel at all, immaculate, elegant, the staff and service were fantastic.
reviews.title: Just Lovely!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is great, just a few minutes from the main square and a short enjoyable walk along the cobbled streets to the Charles Bridge. The rooms are amazing, very large beds, queen size I think, (we had a de-luxe room), flat screen TV, tea and coffee making facilities, mini bar etc. The bathroom was also immaculate with everything you need, hairdryer (and they are good ones, no need to bring your hairdryer girls!), robes, slippers, fresh towels every day. All in all this is a fabulous place and I would recommend it to anyone.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed 3 nights in this hotel at the weekend. We found it to be exceptionally clean, the bed comfortable and the staff very friendly. The best thing about the hotel was the location, which is only a few minutes walk from the main square.
reviews.title: Great Traditional Hotel in the Heart of Prague

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: During our stay, we did have the unpleasant experience of overlapping with some inconsiderate guests, who insisted on disrupting our sleep thanks to the excessive noise they made. The next morning I did get a formal apology from the hotel, along with a bottle of cava in the room. As my wife is pregnant, I declined this, and the hotel made a number of other offers of compensation (including a voucher for 2 nights stay in the future) as an apology.
reviews.title: Location & Cleanliness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: We held our conference at Hotel grand Bohemia because of the location the price and because their gorgeous ballroom was big enough to hold our projected number of participants. Though they did not have enough sleeping rooms, they contracted for more with Hotel Paris across the street. We were rewarded with "can do" service that was very easy to work with.
reviews.title: Superb service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Sleeping rooms were very comfortable and roomy. Free internet in rooms and throughout the hotel.
reviews.title: Great location, otherwise nothing special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011
reviews.text: An overall great experience.
reviews.title: Great place great location great service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am a frequent visitor in Prague, mostly on business and have stayed in a variety of 5* properties so I can really compare. I can neither say this is a 5* hotel nor I would recommend it to others looking for quality for their money.
reviews.title: Look for smething better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will start with some nice things: great location, quiet, yet, close to dining, sightseeing, shopping etc. I got an executive room, which felt quite spacious due to high ceiling - otherwise it is a regular size. It is decorated nicely, but very very plain. There is nothing special about the room at all.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I enjoyed my stay at the Bohemia. The rooms were a little on the small side but they were well kept with soft beds, big pillows, and nice batrooms. They have new flat panel tvs with a decent selection of english channels for killing down time. The hotel is a 2 minute walk to the Old Town Square and about a 15 minute stroll to the Cherles Bridge and river. Plenty of shops, restaraunts, and bars are located in the area. My only real complaint is that the food at the breakfast buffet was cold, cold eggs, pancakes, cold bacon and sausage. It was free so I really can't complain too much. My overall impression was a positive one and I would recommend this hotel to anyone so long as you get a good deal on the price.
reviews.title: Average Hotel In Excellent Location
Absolute delight
reviews.text: Grand Bohemia Prague - a first class room newly decorated with twin beds, sofa 3 armchairs and all this only 3 minutes walk from Old Town Square.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not cheap by any means but still a bargain at the price .
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007
reviews.text: A lovely week-end break
reviews.title: very very comfortable beds!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I spent a long weekend in Prague and rated this hotel very highly. We were a little cautious because it doesn't appear in any guides and we had a pretty good deal, so we thought there must be something wrong!
reviews.title: Utterly comfortable luxury in Prague
The Extra Mile
reviews.text: We stayed at the Grand Hotel Bohemia for two nights in July 2007, the excuse being my 60th birthday. No direct mention was made of my birthday to the hotel (although birthday cards were in the room). On returning from sightseeing we found a complimentary bottle of bubbly and a bowl of fruit in the room. (The extra mile!)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My other half rated the de luxe room 11 out of 10 (see pictures). The interior of the hotel has been recently modernised and is very clean. The staff were very attentive and helpful providing information on how to get around and bus/tram tickets when needed.
reviews.title: Lovely hote, great location.

likes.liked: — the hotel had a very refined yet relaxed attitude

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located in a quiet street near to the Powder Tower and Municipal Building and and on the fringe of the Old Town pedestrian area. The Old Town Square is about 5 minutes walk away. The closest tram stop (for travel further) is about 3 to 4 minutes away
reviews.title: excellent choice
Great Hotel - Elegant
reviews.text: This is a lovely hotel on a quiet street, not far from old town square and right next to the Powder Tower. Our room was generously sized, beds comfortable and the bathroom was lovely. The hotel staff was great about helping us with tours and general information about this lovely city. If you are looking for a lot of action, this is not your hotel. But if you want comfort and gentility book at the Grand Hotel Bohemia, I would go back in a heartbeat. Prague is fantastic.

reviews.title: Nice personal touch
reviews.text: This was recommended to us from 2 different couples who had stayed there in the past year and itr did not disappoint us. Everything you could want was at your fingertips. Very attentive staff, very clean rooms and the location was grand right in the center of the activities but enough off the path to keep the night noise to a minimum. Could highly recommend it. We did not eat in the resturant so I cannot comment on that.

description: Grand Hotel Bohemia is a 5-star luxurious hotel in the heart of Prague's Old Town. Only a few minutes walk divide this noble hotel with 78 elegantly furnished rooms from the main sights, architectonic landmarks and luxury shopping streets of the Old and the New Town of Prague.The Grand Hotel Bohemia has it all - located in town centre and yet very quiet street, hotel has a captivating essence of old times blended with highest comfort and services provided by top team of dedicated professinals.
